climbs.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex
climbs.fa: Rex Pieper and Doug Benner, Dec. 1988

content.description: A short face climb, with a strenuous crux start and some balance moves along a dike higher up.  Shady location
content.location: a wide dike on the northeast face

climbs.name: Two Scoops Please
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger and Dave Houser, Nov. 1978

content.description: Classic stemming up a wide chute
content.location: just left of the route Hands Off, near the north end of the west face

content.description:
This route is described incorrectly in the old Vogel guide.

It begins with a brutally hard mantle (crux) 15 feet right of "Tyrannosaurus Rex." From the top of the mantleshelf, follow the thin dike up and to the right. There is some potential for a big swing if you blow it near the end.
content.protection: Bolts on summit about 60 feet northeast of the top of "Tyrannosaurus Rex."

content.description: A short, fun, steep face in a shady location, with an intriguing sequence at the crux
content.location: Near the north end of the northeast face, 75 feet right of Tyrannosaurus Rex.

content.description: A 5.9 hand crack leads to wild overhanging flared hand jams and wide stems to get up and over the summit block;  Great! (may be much harder for short climbers)
content.location: 20 or 30 feet right of the route Hands Off on the north end of the west face

content.protection: Back in 93 when I did it, it was a few nuts to pro for the TR

climbs.name: Hands Off
climbs.fa: John Long and Brian Portoff, October 1972

content.description:
With it's easy approach, fun moves and varied climbing it's easy to see why this route is so popular.

Located on the left-most section of The Wall, a little before the northern apex of the front loop in Hidden Valley Campground.

The crack is enjoyable throughout it's entire length, with stemming, jamming and combinations of the two techniques all played out on good rock.

Gear belay and a somewhat circuitous but easy downclimb off the slabby backside. Hint: once down to the desert floor, head left and then follow a trail that will circle back towards the base of the climb. Three stars out of five.
